defect.rating: Rating: how serious is the defect?

about.why: If you have ever chosen a car for yourself, you have probably watched a lot of car reviews, where bloggers of different competence told you about the pros and cons of every car and recommended what to buy. The problem is that all of these reviews are subjective, and if you are a rational mature person, and reliability of a car in the long term is important for you, you may be interested in analysis of call statistics service.
about.concurrents: There are awesome sites such as carcomplaints.com, carproblemzoo.com, nhtsa.gov, where people describe problems encountered during the period of their car exploitation. But unfortunately there are no charts on these sites, so you can't visually compare different models and figure out which is more problematic.
about.website: that's why Iâ€™ve created my own website
about.website_details: collecting all the information from these useful resources and presenting it as graphs. Here you can compare car models, model generations and versions, visualize by age or mileage, and, for objectivity, consider normalized data i.e. the number of crashes per 10,000 cars sold. The site has information about 4 million crashes, and you can also contribute to the project by sharing your own experience.
about.project: It's a non-commercial project, created on a voluntary basis, and it is still on alpha release.

honda_accord_vs_toyota_camry.title: Toyota Camry vs Honda Accord in terms of reliability (according to statistics)
honda_accord_vs_toyota_camry.cards:
[{"title":"Toyota Camry Engine","text":"The Toyota Camry also offers a variety of engine choices
 A base engine is often a 2.5-liter inline-4 engine
 There's also a more powerful 3.5-liter V6 engine available in some trims
 The Camry Hybrid uses a 2.5-liter 4-cylinder engine combined with an electric motor."},{"title":"Honda Accord Engine","text":"The Honda Accord typically offers a range of engine options, with variations depending on the trim level and model year
 A common engine found in the Accord is the 1.5-liter turbocharged inline-4 engine
 The more powerful option is usually a 2.0-liter turbocharged inline-4 engine
 The Accord Hybrid features a 2.0-liter Atkinson-cycle inline-4 engine combined with an electric motor."},{"title":"Toyota Camry Transmission","text":"The Camry often offers an 8-speed automatic transmission with the 2.5-liter engine
 The 3.5-liter V6 engine is typically paired with an 8-speed automatic transmission as well
 The Camry Hybrid utilizes an electronically-controlled continuously variable transmission (ECVT)."},{"title":"Honda Accord Transmission","text":" The Accord typically comes with a continuously variable transmission (CVT) paired with its 1.5-liter engine
 The 2.0-liter engine is often mated to a 10-speed automatic transmission
 The Accord Hybrid features an e-CVT (electronic Continuously Variable Transmission)."},{"title":"Toyota Camry Suspension","text":"The Camry also uses a front MacPherson strut suspension and a multi-link rear suspension for similar ride comfort and handling characteristics."},{"title":"Honda Accord Suspension","text":"The Accord usually has a front MacPherson strut suspension and a multi-link rear suspension, which provides a good balance between ride comfort and handling."}]
